verses.verse: (For the choir director; according to Jeduthun. A Psalm of Asaph.) My <S%H6963>voice<s%> [rises] to <S%H430>God,<s%> and I will <S%H6817>cry<s%> <S%H6817>aloud;<s%> My <S%H6963>voice<s%> [rises] to <S%H430>God,<s%> and He will <S%H238>hear<s%> me.

In the <S%H3117>day<s%> of my <S%H6869>trouble<s%> I <S%H1875>sought<s%> the <S%H136>Lord;<s%> In the <S%H3915>night<s%> my <S%H3027>hand<s%> was <S%H5064>stretched<s%> out <S%H3808>without<s%> <S%H6313>weariness;<s%> My <S%H5315>soul<s%> <S%H3985>refused<s%> to be <S%H5162>comforted.<s%>
[When] I <S%H2142>remember<s%> <S%H430>God,<s%> then I am <S%H1993>disturbed;<s%> [When] I <S%H7878>sigh,<s%> then my <S%H7307>spirit<s%> <S%H5848>grows<s%> <S%H5848>faint.<s%> <S%H5542>Selah.<s%>
Thou hast <S%H270>held<s%> my <S%H5869>eyelids<s%> <S%H8109><s%> [open]; I am so <S%H6470>troubled<s%> that I <S%H3808>cannot<s%> <S%H1696>speak.<s%>
I have <S%H2803>considered<s%> the <S%H3117>days<s%> of <S%H6924>old,<s%> The <S%H8141>years<s%> of <S%H5769>long<s%> <S%H5769>ago.<s%>
I will <S%H2142>remember<s%> my <S%H5058>song<s%> in the <S%H3915>night;<s%> I will <S%H7878>meditate<s%> with my <S%H3824>heart;<s%> And my <S%H7307>spirit<s%> <S%H2664>ponders.<s%>
Will the <S%H136>Lord<s%> <S%H2186>reject<s%> <S%H5769>forever<s%>? And will He <S%H3808>never<s%> be <S%H7521>favorable<s%> <S%H3254>again<s%>?
Has His <S%H2617>lovingkindness<s%> <S%H656>ceased<s%> <S%H5331>forever<s%>? Has [His] <S%H561>promise<s%> <S%H1584>come<s%> to an <S%H1584>end<s%> <S%H1755>forever<s%>?
Has <S%H410>God<s%> <S%H7911>forgotten<s%> to be <S%H2603>gracious<s%>? <S%H518>Or<s%> has He in <S%H639>anger<s%> <S%H7092>withdrawn<s%> His <S%H7356>compassion<s%>? <S%H5542>Selah.<s%>
Then I <S%H559>said,<s%> "It is my <S%H2470>grief,<s%> That the <S%H3225>right<s%> <S%H3225>hand<s%> of the <S%H9411>Most<s%> <S%H9411>High<s%> has <S%H8132>changed.<s%>"
I shall <S%H2142>remember<s%> the <S%H4611>deeds<s%> of the <S%H3050>Lord;<s%> <S%H3588>Surely<s%> I will <S%H2142>remember<s%> Thy <S%H6382>wonders<s%> of <S%H6924>old.<s%>
I will <S%H1897>meditate<s%> on <S%H3605>all<s%> Thy <S%H6467>work,<s%> And <S%H7878>muse<s%> on Thy <S%H5949>deeds.<s%>
Thy <S%H1870>way,<s%> O <S%H430>God,<s%> is <S%H6944>holy;<s%> <S%H4310>What<s%> <S%H410>god<s%> is <S%H1419>great<s%> like our <S%H430>God<s%>?
Thou art the <S%H410>God<s%> who <S%H6213>workest<s%> <S%H6382>wonders;<s%> Thou hast <S%H3045>made<s%> <S%H3045>known<s%> Thy <S%H5797>strength<s%> among the <S%H5971>peoples.<s%>
Thou hast by Thy <S%H2220>power<s%> <S%H1350>redeemed<s%> Thy <S%H5971>people,<s%> The <S%H1121>sons<s%> of <S%H3290>Jacob<s%> and <S%H3130>Joseph.<s%> <S%H5542>Selah.<s%>

The <S%H4325>waters<s%> <S%H7200>saw<s%> Thee, O <S%H430>God;<s%> The <S%H4325>waters<s%> <S%H7200>saw<s%> Thee, they were in <S%H9123>anguish;<s%> The <S%H8415>deeps<s%> <S%H637>also<s%> <S%H7264>trembled.<s%>
The <S%H5645>clouds<s%> <S%H2229>poured<s%> out <S%H4325>water;<s%> The <S%H7834>skies<s%> <S%H5414>gave<s%> forth a <S%H6963>sound;<s%> Thy <S%H2671>arrows<s%> <S%H1980>flashed<s%> here and there.

The <S%H6963>sound<s%> of Thy <S%H7482>thunder<s%> was in the <S%H1534>whirlwind;<s%> The <S%H1300>lightnings<s%> <S%H215>lit<s%> up the <S%H8398>world;<s%> The <S%H776>earth<s%> <S%H7264>trembled<s%> and <S%H7493>shook.<s%>
Thy <S%H1870>way<s%> was in the <S%H3220>sea,<s%> And Thy <S%H7635>paths<s%> in the <S%H7227>mighty<s%> <S%H4325>waters,<s%> And Thy <S%H6119>footprints<s%> may not be <S%H3045>known.<s%>
Thou didst <S%H5148>lead<s%> Thy <S%H5971>people<s%> like a <S%H6629>flock,<s%> By the <S%H3027>hand<s%> of <S%H4872>Moses<s%> and <S%H175>Aaron.<s%>
